data.event: In 1538, walls were built around Jerusalem under Suleiman the Magnificent.
Today those walls define the Old City, which has been traditionally divided into four quarters—known since the early 19th century as the Armenian, Christian, Jewish, and Muslim Quarters.

event.title: known since the early 19th century as the Armenian, Christian, Jewish, and Muslim Quarters

data.event: Today those walls define the Old City, which has been traditionally divided into four quarters—known since the early 19th century as the Armenian, Christian, Jewish, and Muslim Quarters.

event.title: became a World Heritage Site in 1981

data.event: The Old City became a World Heritage Site in 1981, and is on the List of World Heritage in Danger.
